paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses two variants in the TTR gene associated with transthyretin-related familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP) and their implications in domino liver transplantation.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No symptoms of FAP; small amyloid deposits detected
individual_records.evidence_sentence: While neither patient had symptoms of FAP, small amyloid deposits were detected on the gastroduodenal mucosae 14 months and 12 years after DLT in patient 1 and patient 2, respectively.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No clinical symptoms; small amyloid deposits detected 12 years after DLT
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The presence of amyloid deposits has been checked almost every year with gastroduodenal mucosal biopsy, and amyloid deposits were first detected on both gastric and duodenal mucosae at 45 years old (12 years after DLT).

functional_data.summary: The amyloid was composed mostly of variant TTR produced from the transplanted liver.

variants.segregation_data: Not applicable; no family data provided.
variants.additional_notes: Both patients were asymptomatic at the time of evaluation despite the presence of amyloid deposits.
key_quotes: This is the first study to successfully capture the pathological and biochemical features of initial-stage amyloid lesions in DLT recipients.
The findings clearly indicate that amyloid deposition can start by deposition of variant TTR followed by deposition of wild-type TTR.
